intro: Dactyladenia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy dactyladenia, is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape and have a rough texture. Dactyladenia hirsuta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
